message.content:
1) What should the UI look like? The UI will feature a shadow control panel designed to adjust inner shadow effects for an element. This control panel will include sliders or input fields to modify properties such as shadow size, shadow blur, and shadow color. Additionally, a preview area will display the effect of the adjustments in real time. 2) What are the individual components that make up the UI? - **ShadowControlPanel**: Standalone component. - **PreviewArea**: Standalone component showing the element with the applied inner shadow. - **AdjustmentSlider**: Component that takes children, used for sliders like size and blur. - **ColorPickerInput**: Standalone component, an input for selecting colors. 3) What does the HTML for the UI look like? ```html

Inner Shadow Controls

Size Blur
``` 4) What is the HTML for each component? - **PreviewArea**: ```html

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The carousel slider should display a series of images one at a time with controls to navigate through them, typically left and right arrows. There should also be indicators showing the current position in the image sequence. The carousel should be responsive, adjusting seamlessly across different screen sizes. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **CarouselContainer** (Standalone): The main wrapper for the carousel that includes the navigation buttons and the indicators. - **CarouselSlide** (Takes children): Represents each individual slide in the carousel which can display an image. - **NavigationButton** (Standalone): Buttons to navigate the carousel left or right. - **IndicatorDot** (Standalone): Small dots to indicate the current slide position. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **CarouselContainer**: ```html
{children}
``` - **CarouselSlide**: ```html
{children}
``` - **NavigationButton**: ```html ``` - **IndicatorDot**: ```html ```

1) **What should the UI look like?** The UI should feature a simple, user-friendly contact/feedback form including fields for the user's name, email, subject, and a textarea for the message. Additionally, there should be a submit button. The form should be centered on the page and adaptively resize for different screen sizes. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **FormContainer** (Standalone): This component wraps the entire form, providing padding and layout styles. - **InputField** (Takes children): Used for rendering text inputs like name, email, and subject. - **TextAreaField** (Takes children): Specifically for the message text area. - **SubmitButton** (Standalone): A button for form submission. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **FormContainer** ```html
{children}

``` - **TextAreaField** ```html

``` - **SubmitButton** ```html ``` Each component maintains the necessary structure and standards for a responsive and accessible form, using proper labeling and required fields to guide the user input effectively.

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI should feature a simple footer at the bottom of the page displaying copyright information relevant to the current year and the owner or organization name. It should be centralized and visible easily. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **FooterContainer** (Standalone): This component encapsulates the styling and structure of the footer. - **CopyrightText** (Standalone): This component specifically handles the display of the copyright text. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The Calculator Widget UI should feature a simple, grid-based layout with rows for display and interactive numeric keys, arithmetic operators, and a result display. The design should be clean with clearly distinguishable buttons for different operations (e.g., numbers, basic arithmetic operators, clear, and equals button). The result display should be prominently placed at the top. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **CalculatorWidget:** Standalone component encompassing the entire calculator functionality. - **DisplayPanel:** Standalone component for displaying calculations and results. - **ButtonPanel:** Standalone component containing all the interactive buttons. - **CalculatorButton:** Component that takes children; represents individual buttons on the calculator. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **DisplayPanel:** ```html

``` - **ButtonPanel:** ```html

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI will display a simplified version of a stock chart or candlestick chart in a grid format. Each "candle" will be represented by a div, showing the open and close values as well as high and low indicators. This display should be responsive, adjusting the number of columns based on the screen size. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **ChartContainer (Standalone)**: This component acts as a container for the entire chart, setting up the responsive grid layout. - **Candle (Children)**: Represents a single candle in the candlestick chart. It displays open, close, high, and low values of the stock for that particular time interval. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
{open_value}
{high_value}
{low_value}
{close_value}
{open_value_2}
{high_value_2}
{low_value_2}
{close_value_2}
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **ChartContainer:** ```html

prompt: Map interface allowing users to interact with and explore geographic data

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** - A full-screen map interface with tools for zooming in and out. - A sidebar for displaying information about selected regions or locations on the map. - Buttons or controls for interaction, such as pan, zoom, and layer switching. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **MapContainer** (Standalone): This component encapsulates the full map display area. - **Sidebar** (Takes children): This is a component for showing additional information or controls related to the map content. - **ZoomControls** (Standalone): This component includes buttons to zoom in and out of the map. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

Explore geographic data about various regions. Select an area to view more details here.
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **Sidebar:** ```html
{children}

prompt: Avatar or thumbnail representing a user

message.content:
1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI should display a circular avatar, typically used to represent a user. The avatar can either contain an image if available or fallback to displaying the user's initials on a solid color background when the image is not available. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **Avatar**: Standalone component - This component displays either an image or the initials of a user depending on the availability of an image. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **Avatar**: ```html
{userImage ? `` : `{userInitials}`}
```

1) **What should the UI look like?** - The UI will consist of a modal (popup dialog) that appears over the main content of the page. The modal will contain some text, a title, and two buttons: one to close the modal and another optional button that can perform another action (like "Learn more" or "Confirm"). - The modal should have a background overlay to slightly obscure the main page content and bring focus to the modal dialog. - The modal should be centered on the screen and styled to be visually distinct from the rest of the page. 2) **What are the individual components that make up the UI?** - **Overlay**: Standalone component that renders a semi-transparent background overlay. - **Modal**: Takes children. This component represents the modal dialog which contains the content and action buttons. - **ModalHeader**: Standalone component for the heading section of the modal. - **ModalBody**: Takes children. Used for the content area of the modal. - **ModalFooter**: Takes children. Contains the action buttons of the modal. - **Button**: Standalone component for the buttons. 3) **What does the HTML for the UI look like?** ```html

{modalContent}
``` 4) **What is the HTML for each component?** - **Overlay**: ```html
``` - **Modal**: ```html
{children}
``` - **ModalHeader**: ```html

{modalTitle}

``` - **ModalBody**: ```html
{children}
``` - **ModalFooter**: ```html
{children}
``` - **Button**: ```html ``` In practice, modal content (`{modalContent}`), modal title (`{modalTitle}`), and button texts (`{buttonText}`) would vary based on the specific use case and can be dynamically replaced.
